description.narrative: IPS aims to contribute to the transformation of Turkish media towards rights-based journalistic values and to become a reliable outlet of independent news with a rights-based, multi-voice approach.Bianet, the news portal of IPS Foundation, has become a model for free and independent news reporting with a rights-based approach. The objectives of IPS can be summarized under three headlines: (I) The Editorial Desk works for enhancing the role of the media and becoming an example of independent news channel acting as an open space for sharing, and producing reliable and non-biased news on human rights. (II) The Freedom of Expression Work monitors and publishes news and reports on the violations, developments and the struggle on Freedom of Expression and Press Freedom. III) The Training and Capacity Building Work provides training programs and resource materials for the promotion of rights-based journalism with an aim to introduce independent and rights focused journalism.

IPS har som målsättning att bidra till omvandlingen av turkiska medier till rättighetsbaserade journalistiska värderingar och att bli en pålitlig källa till oberoende nyheter med ett rättighetsbaserat, mångsidigt tillvägagångssätt. Bianet, nyhetsportalen för IPS Foundation, har blivit en modell för öppen och oberoende nyhetsrapportering med ett rättighetsbaserat tillvägagångssätt. Målen för IPS kan sammanfattas under tre rubriker:
(I) Redaktionsdisken arbetar för att stärka medias roll och bli ett exempel på oberoende nyhetskanaler som fungerar som ett öppet utrymme för delning och ger tillförlitliga och opartiska nyheter om mänskliga rättigheter.
(II) Yttrandefrihetsarbetet övervakar och publicerar nyheter och rapporter om överträdelser, utvecklingar och om kampen om yttrande- och pressfrihet.
III) Utbildnings- och kapacitetsbyggnadsarbetet tillhandahåller utbildningsprogram och resursmaterial för att främja rättighetsbaserad journalistik med målet att införa oberoende och rättighetsfokuserad journalistik.

The intervention aims to increase the quality of journalism standards in Turkey by way of disseminating principles of ethical journalism with a human rights based approach (HRBA). This is done via both Bianet's own publishing as well as its capacity building activities. The objectives of IPS can be summarized under three headlines:(I) The Editorial Desk works for enhancing the role of the media and becoming an example of independent news channel acting as an open space for sharing, and producing reliable and non-biased news on human rights.(II) The Freedom of Expression Work monitors and publishes news and reports on the violations, developments and the struggle on Freedom of Expression (FoE) and Press Freedom.III) The Training and Capacity Building Work provides training programs and resource materials for the promotion of rights-based journalism with an aim to introduce independent and rights focused journalism.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

tag.narrative: 10.2 - By 2030, empower and promote the social, economic and political inclusion of all, irrespective of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion or economic or other status.

10.2 - Till 2030 möjliggöra och verka för att alla människors, oavsett ålder, kön, funktionsnedsättning, ras, etnicitet, ursprung, religion eller ekonomisk eller annan ställning, blir inkluderade i det sociala, ekonomiska och politiska livet.
16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

description.narrative: bianet has continued to supply news in Turkish, Kurdish and English and acts as an independent news platform in a constrained media landscape. They have continued to deliver articles with a rights based approach and equality, multiplicity, partiality were reflected in the editorial policy of the outlet. Special coverage was done on children, women and environment. The unique visitors and number of page views have continued to increase. bianet still is not widely known by the general public hence it still stands out as a reliable and trustworthy news source and is referred by many CSOs, INGOs, national and international bodies. Monitoring and reporting killed, imprisoned or attacked journalists as well as sub-sections such as closed/confiscated media organizations; dismissed media workers; social media related arrests; closed/banned websites, internet slowdowns still carried on. bianet is still among the few left one of the outlets that consistently follow and covers judicial proceedings of those whose professional and civil rights are violated under statutory decrees. Male violence tally is still an important infographic published by the foundation. Workshops are designed to reflect the experience journalists as well as to cover the current trends and discussions around journalism. The goal to keep the high standards of journalism is hope to be achieved by these trainings. Atölye BIA was set up to fill the gap of courses and implementation on rights-based journalism in communication faculties of universities. The increasing number of application to the workshops throughout the years is an indication of the interest of young journalists. Previously organized Atölye BIA workshops will be available on the website in text, video, and podcast for a wider reach. bianet is carrying on its activities with a focus on people’s rights to information. It serves as an important media outlet of independent journalism where the standards for ethically and politically responsible journalism is raised. It keeps on serving news with the idea of social benefit in production and distribution of information
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
